mil3.7.5:0.3: Question on Arising in Two Places Taking the Same Time
mil3.7.5:1.2: “Venerable Nāgasena, for one who having passed away is reborn in the Brahma world, and for one who having passed away is reborn in Kashmir, which one takes the longer time, and which the shorter?”
mil3.7.5:2.2: “Where then, your majesty, is your town of birth?”
mil3.7.5:2.3: “There is a place called Kalasigāma, there I was born.”
mil3.7.5:2.4: “How far away, your majesty, is Kalasigāma from here?”
mil3.7.5:2.6: “How far away, your majesty, is Kashmir from here?”
mil3.7.5:2.8: “Go on then, your majesty, think about Kalasigāma.”
mil3.7.5:2.9: “I have thought about it, venerable sir.”
mil3.7.5:2.10: “Go on then, your majesty, think about Kashmir.”
mil3.7.5:2.11: “I have thought about it, venerable sir.”
mil3.7.5:2.12: “Which thinking took a long time, your majesty, and which a short time?”
mil3.7.5:2.14: “Just so, your majesty, for one who having passed away is reborn in the Brahma world, and for one who having passed away is reborn in Kashmir, they happen in the same time.”
mil3.7.5:3.2: “What do you think, your majesty, if two birds fly in the sky and one sits in a high tree, and the other in a low tree, if these happen at the same time, the shadow of which one would settle on the ground first, and which one later?”
mil3.7.5:3.4: “Just so, your majesty, for one who having passed away is reborn in the Brahma world, and for one who having passed away is reborn in Kashmir, they happen in the same time.”
mil3.7.5:5.1: Question on Arising in Two Places Taking the Same Time fifth
